title: Calendar
description: Returns all prayer times for a specific calendar month.
name: GetCalendar

Parameter.description: The decimal value for the latitude co-ordinate of the location you want the time computed for. Example: 51.75865125
The decimal value for the longitude co-ordinate of the location you want the time computed for. Example: -1.25387785
A gregorian calendar month. Example: 8 or 08 for August.
A gregorian calendar year. Example: 2014.
If true, we'll ignore the month and return the calendar for the whole year.

A prayer times calculatiomn method. Methods identify various schools of thought about how to compute the timings. This parameter accepts values from 0-12 and 99, as specified below:
0 - Shia Ithna-Ansari
1 - Muslim World League
2 - Islamic Society of North America
3 - Egyptian General Authority of Survey
4 - Umm Al-Qura University, Makkah
5 - University of Islamic Sciences, Karachi
7 - Institute of Geophysics, University of Tehran
8 - Gulf Region
9 - Kuwait
10 - Qatar
11 - Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura, Singapore
12 - Union Organization islamic de France
13 - Diyanet İşleri Başkanlığı, Turkey
0 for Shafi (or the standard way), 1 for Hanafi. If you leave this empty, it defaults to Shafii.
A valid timezone name as specified on http://php.net/manual/en/timezones.php . Example: Europe/London. If you do not specify these, we'll calcuate it using the co-ordinates you provide.

Method for adjusting times higher latitudes - for instance, if you are checking timings in the UK or Sweden.
1 - Middle of the Night
2 - One Seventh
3 - Angle Based

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: Calendar by address
description: Returns all prayer times for a specific calendar month at a particular address.
name: GetCalendarByAddress

Parameter.description: An address string. Example: 1420 Austin Bluffs Parkway, Colorado Springs, CO OR 25 Hampstead High Street, London, NW3 1RL, United Kingdom OR Sultanahmet Mosque, Istanbul, Turkey
A gregorian calendar month. Example: 8 or 08 for August.
A gregorian calendar year. Example: 2014.
If true, we'll ignore the month and return the calendar for the whole year.

A prayer times calculatiomn method. Methods identify various schools of thought about how to compute the timings. This parameter accepts values from 0-12 and 99, as specified below:
0 - Shia Ithna-Ansari

10 - Qatar
11 - Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura, Singapore
12 - Union Organization islamic de France
13 - Diyanet İşleri Başkanlığı, Turkey
0 for Shafi (or the standard way), 1 for Hanafi. If you leave this empty, it defaults to Shafii.
A valid timezone name as specified on http://php.net/manual/en/timezones.php . Example: Europe/London. If you do not specify these, we'll calcuate it using the co-ordinates you provide.

Method for adjusting times higher latitudes - for instance, if you are checking timings in the UK or Sweden.
1 - Middle of the Night
2 - One Seventh
3 - Angle Based

title: Calendar by City
description: Returns all prayer times for a specific calendar month by City.
name: GetCalendarByCitys

Parameter.description: A city name. Example: London
A country name or 2 character alpha ISO 3166 code. Examples: GB or United Kindom
State or province. A state name or abbreviation. Examples: Colorado / CO / Punjab / Bengal
A gregorian calendar month. Example: 8 or 08 for August.
A gregorian calendar year. Example: 2014.
If true, we'll ignore the month and return the calendar for the whole year.

A prayer times calculatiomn method. Methods identify various schools of thought about how to compute the timings. This parameter accepts values from 0-12 and 99, as specified below:
0 - Shia Ithna-Ansari

8 - Gulf Region
9 - Kuwait
10 - Qatar
11 - Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura, Singapore
12 - Union Organization islamic de France
13 - Diyanet İşleri Başkanlığı, Turkey
0 for Shafi (or the standard way), 1 for Hanafi. If you leave this empty, it defaults to Shafii.
A valid timezone name as specified on http://php.net/manual/en/timezones.php . Example: Europe/London. If you do not specify these, we'll calcuate it using the co-ordinates you provide.

Method for adjusting times higher latitudes - for instance, if you are checking timings in the UK or Sweden.

2 - One Seventh
3 - Angle Based

title: Current Date
description: Returns the current date (in the DD-MM-YYYY format) for the specified time zone
name: GetCurrentDate

Parameter.description: A valid timezone name as specified on http://php.net/manual/en/timezones.php<. Example: Europe/London

title: Current Time
description: Returns the current time (in the HH:MM format) for the specified time zone
name: GetCurrentTime

Parameter.description: A valid timezone name as specified on http://php.net/manual/en/timezones.php<. Example: Europe/London

title: Current Timestamp
description: Returns the current UNIX timestamp for the specified time zone
name: GetCurrentTimestamp

Parameter.description: A valid timezone name as specified on http://php.net/manual/en/timezones.php<. Example: Europe/London

title: Address Geolocation info
description: Returns the latitude, longitude and timezone for a given address
name: GetAddressInfo

Parameter.description: An address string. Example: 1420 Austin Bluffs Parkway, Colorado Springs, CO OR 25 Hampstead High Street, London, NW3 1RL, United Kingdom OR Sultanahmet Mosque, Istanbul, Turkey

examples.title: Example usage:
examples.content: http://api.aladhan.com/addressInfo?address=1420 Austin Bluffs Parkway, Colorado Springs, CO 80918

title: City Geolocation info
description: Returns the latitude, longitude and timezone for a given city
name: GetCityInfo

Parameter.description: A city name. Example: London
A country name or 2 character alpha ISO 3166 code. Examples: GB or United Kindom
State or province. A state name or abbreviation. Examples: Colorado / CO / Punjab / Bengal

title: Prayer Times Methods
description: Returns all the prayer times calculation methods supported by this API. For more information on how to use custom methods, see https://aladhan.com/calculation-methods.
name: GetMethods

examples.title: Success-Response:

title: Timings
description: Returns all prayer times for a specific date.
name: GetTimings

Parameter.description: A date in the DD-MM-YYYY format or UNIX timestamp. Default's to the current date.
The decimal value for the latitude co-ordinate of the location you want the time computed for. Example: 51.75865125
The decimal value for the longitude co-ordinate of the location you want the time computed for. Example: -1.25387785

A prayer times calculatiomn method. Methods identify various schools of thought about how to compute the timings. This parameter accepts values from 0-12 and 99, as specified below:
0 - Shia Ithna-Ansari
1 - Muslim World League
2 - Islamic Society of North America
3 - Egyptian General Authority of Survey
4 - Umm Al-Qura University, Makkah
5 - University of Islamic Sciences, Karachi
7 - Institute of Geophysics, University of Tehran
8 - Gulf Region
9 - Kuwait
10 - Qatar
11 - Majlis Ugama Islam Singapura, Singapore
12 - Union Organization islamic de France
13 - Diyanet İşleri Başkanlığı, Turkey
0 for Shafi (or the standard way), 1 for Hanafi. If you leave this empty, it defaults to Shafii.
A valid timezone name as specified on http://php.net/manual/en/timezones.php . Example: Europe/London. If you do not specify these, we'll calcuate it using the co-ordinates you provide.

Method for adjusting times higher latitudes - for instance, if you are checking timings in the UK or Sweden.
1 - Middle of the Night
2 - One Seventh
3 - Angle Based
